job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Brant, ON
pros: Fair pay, many great coworkers.
cons: Staffing issues and problems with equity at times.

pros: An innovative centre for research and clinical practice. A provincial leader in Mental Health, Urology, Internal Medicine and more.
cons: If you are a front line worker, you are not valued. Rather, you’re made to work long hours with no overtime. Your caring nature and integrity are your motivators, but your rewards are simply knowing you helped others. There is little room for promotion. Most employees who are healthcare providers are kept at part time, so that no benefits are provided. The organization is extremely top heavy with managers who are largely unqualified for their portfolios. If you are in the ‘inner cliques’ you might have a chance, but unfortunately when you try to do your best for your clients you might be castigated for exposing the hospital to criticism. A favourite line from management is ‘Do Not Throw St. Joe’s Under the Bus’. Public image is everything to this organization at the expense of their patients.

review_title: From an IT perspective: Doesn't take IT seriously
pros: Good pay, nice people, nice employee wellness programs. Good hospital.
cons: I can't speak for other departments but my review is just for IT: Outdated technology, no IT processes, IT tools are weak and do not allow employees to perform well, manual tasks which can be automated. There is no vision to become a better, more efficient IT department. There is no overall picture of where IT is headed and no real leadership or ideas to improve this area. IT is definitely not their main focus so the org doesn't understand how important it really is. Unrealistic timelines for projects and workload seems to be distributed unevenly.

review_title: Work at St. Joseph's and Proud of it
pros: Working at St. Joseph's Healthcare provides me with a deep sense of pride that I am part of an Organization that provides excellent care to all patients. St. Joseph's truly lives up to its Mission Statement.
cons: The only downfall I can see with working at St. Joseph's or for that matter any government funded organization is that funding is now always distributed by the government according to need. During these times when we are expected to do more with less due to cuts in government funding it can be stressful.

review_title: Working for St. Joseph's Healthcare Hamilton has been extremely rewarding for me.
pros: Working with a great team has made my job enjoyable and rewarding
cons: One of the most challenging parts of my job is working with concurrent disorders clients addicted to Crystal Meth. It is so sad to see what that terrible drug can do to a person
